column4: How do I set ubuntu to autmatically mount an ntfs partition on login?
add a proper entry to the /etc/fstab
that command - mountes it once.. if you want a permenet mount. You add a proper entry in /etc/fstab.  the ntfs-3g wiki page gives examples.
example from, my /etc/fstab -->  #UUID=6A62B9CC1192CB2D/media/VistaBootntfs-3gdefaults,locale=en_US.utf800
example from, my /etc/fstab -->  UUID=6A62B9CC1192CB2D /media/VistaBoot ntfs-3g defaults,locale=en_US.utf8 0 0
gparted does not add entries to fstab.
why?  you have read the docs mentioned and added a line to your fstab yet?
you could perhaps install and run the 'ntfs-config' tool also. that might auto-add the proper entrys to fstab
is "mount point" where you want the icon for the location to be? or is that the actual location its going to be at?
its the /media/WHATEVERMAKE_THIS_DIR_FIRST    location you want
its not difficult.. i gave you an example line that would do it. (with some editing) OR as i suggested.. install and run the 'ntfs-config' tool
example from, my /etc/fstab -->  UUID=6A62B9CC1192CB2D /media/VistaBoot ntfs-3g defaults,locale=en_US.utf8 0 0
use your uuid. make that VistaBoot Dir.. (or whatever dir you want) and there ya go.
